CUSBD_Req_s Struct Reference
Dynamic Data Structures

#include <cusbd_structs_if.h>

Data Fields

uint32_t actual
 

Detailed Description

Transfer request structure. I/O transfers of higher layers are realized with the help of CUSBD_Req objects. CUSBD_Req is associated with endpoints.

Field Documentation

uint32_t CUSBD_Req_s::actual

number of actually processed bytes

uint8_t* CUSBD_Req_s::buf

buffer with data to transfer - virtual address

CUSBD_CbReqComplete CUSBD_Req_s::complete

Callback function called on the transfer completion event

void* CUSBD_Req_s::context

general-use data hook driver doesn't make use of this field. May be dsed in complete callback function

uintptr_t CUSBD_Req_s::dma

physical address of buf buffer

uint32_t CUSBD_Req_s::length

This transfer data length

LIST_ListHead CUSBD_Req_s::list

Head of the list.

CUSBD_Req* CUSBD_Req_s::nextReq

pointer to the next request in the linked list

uint8_t CUSBD_Req_s::noInterrupt

Setting this flag to 1 disables generating of transfer completion interrupt

CUSBD_Req* CUSBD_Req_s::prevReq

pointer to the previous request in the linked list

uint8_t CUSBD_Req_s::requestPending

Internal flag used by driver to mark request as pending

uint8_t CUSBD_Req_s::shortNotOk

Setting this flag causes all reading transfers with short packet as erroneous

uint32_t CUSBD_Req_s::status

keeps actual status of request

uint16_t CUSBD_Req_s::streamId

stream id - used only in Super Speed mode

uint8_t CUSBD_Req_s::zero

Setting this flag to 1 causes adding zero length data packet at the end of data transfer when data transfer length is a multiple of MaxPacketSize for endpoint
